name: Louet Drum Carder Elite (Extra Fine Cloth)
description:
This carder was designed for the spinners who want to be able to perform a range of techniques on their carder. There are many new features - The carding cloth for one. The teeth are made with finer wire and the spacing is closer than the Classic Drumcarder. The licker-in drum has a short needle carding cloth that is spirally attached to it so it can efficiently feed a variety of fibers onto the large drum. The licker-in drum can be adjusted closer to or further from the swift drum depending on the fibers you are carding using the adjusting knobs. There are two in feed speeds so you can blend different fibers with ease without fibers gulping on or getting damaged. There is also an in feed tray that you use to stage the order that you feed the fibers and colors on. The carder is designed to do a range of tasks - it can perform basic carding tasks, blending colors and it can also easily blend a variety of fibers into batts. If you want a versatile drumcarder - this is the one.

Specifications:
- Drum is 7«" (19 cm) wide and 10" (25 cm) in diameter
- Slower surface speed ratios: 23:1 and 34:1
- Lighter gauge wire for the carding teeth
- Teeth are spaced at 72 teeth/sq inch
- Universal licker-in cloth
- Large and foldable in feed tray
- Card approximately « ounce (15 grams) per batt
- Weight 16.5 pounds (7.5 kg)
- Adjustable drums
- Table Clamps, Doffer Brush and Doffer Pin included

An instruction manual written by well known author and fiber artist Deb Menz is included with all drumcarders.
The Louet Drumcarders are made of laminated birch and have a hard white coating. In order to ensure a long life, the teeth on all Lou?t carders are made of high grade plated steel wire. All gearboxes (except on the Elite) are enclosed to prevent fibers entering the gear system.

Suggest retail price is $825.00 You save $100.00. Shipping is free.

We are only authorized to sell these in the U.S. and Canada.

name: Louet XL Drum Carder Standard
description:
New in 2013, the XL Standard Drumcarder is a Clydesdale! The diameter of the drum is 10 1/2" and the width is 11.5". The carder clamps to a table and comes already permanently adjusted for you. The carder is designed to accommodate fine to medium fiber lengths. The teeth on the carder are 3/8" deep and a batt of about an ounce can be produced. Color blending can be done with success as well.

Specifications:
- Drum is 11.5" (30 cm) wide and 10«" (26.5 cm) in diameter
- Surface speed ratio is 12:1
- Teeth are spaced at 72 teeth/sq inch
- Teeth are 3/8" deep (11 mm)
- Card approximately 1 ounce (30 grams) per batt
- Weight 20 pounds (9 kg)
- Carding teeth flexible
- No pre-teasing needed
- Table clamps, doffer brush and doffer pin included

An instruction manual written by well known author and fiber artist Deb Menz is included with all drumcarders.
The Louet Drumcarders are made of laminated birch and have a hard white coating. In order to ensure a long life, the teeth on all Lou?t carders are made of high grade plated steel wire. All gearboxes (except on the Elite) are enclosed to prevent fibers entering the gear system.

Suggested retail price is $675.00 You save $100.00. Shipping is free.

We are only authorized to sell these in the U.S. and Canada.

The Standard Drumcarder is a workhorse. The diameter of the drum is 10«" and the width is 7«". The carder clamps to a table and comes already permanently adjusted for you. The carder is designed to accommodate fine to medium fiber lengths. The teeth on the carder are 3/8" deep and a batt of about an ounce can be produced. Color blending can be done with success as well.

name: Louet Classic Drum Carder (Fine Cloth)
description:
The Classic Drumcarder used to be called the Standard Drumcarder and has been with us for over 20 years. The diameter of the drum is 10" and the width is 7«". Compared to the new Standard Drumcarder the cloth has less and higher teeth (46 teeth/sq inch, 5/8" long) and the teeth were designed to intertwine. This makes the Classic Drumcarder more suitable for medium to long fibers. It is the perfect carder if your needs include carding lots of thick batts fast. It is great to card batts for layers for felt making and color blending can be done with success as well. The carder clamps to a table and comes already permanently adjusted for you.

Specifications:
- Drum is 7«" (19 cm) wide and 10" (25 cm) in diameter
- Surface speed ratio is 9:1
- Teeth are spaced at 46 teeth/sq inch
- Teeth are 5/8" deep (14 mm)
- Card approximately 1« ounces (45 grams) per batt
- Weight 16 pounds (7 kg)
- Carding teeth flexible
- No pre-teasing needed
-Table Clamps, Doffer Brush and Doffer Pin included

An instruction manual written by well known author and fiber artist Deb Menz is included with all drumcarders.
The Louet Drumcarders are made of laminated birch and have a hard white coating. In order to ensure a long life, the teeth on all Lou?t carders are made of high grade plated steel wire. All gearboxes (except on the Elite) are enclosed to prevent fibers entering the gear system.

Suggested retail is $615.00 You save $75.00. Shipping is free.

We are only authorized to sell these in the U.S. and Canada.

name: Louet Roving Carder (Extra Fine Cloth)
description:
If you card fibers occasionally or card for small projects, this is the carder for you. It has the same carding cloth and solid construction as the Standard Drumcarder, but is only 4" wide. It is perfect to use to card fibers for small projects like for socks, hats and scarves. You can produce a 4" wide batt that can be spun from when you remove the batt from the carder. The batt that is created is the size of a commercial roving. You can also thoroughly blend colors on this model. It is a great introduction to the world of drum carding.

Specifications:
- Drum is 4" (10 cm) wide and 10 1/2" (26.5 cm) in diameter
- Surface speed ratio is 12:1
- Teeth are spaced at 72 teeth/sq inch
- Teeth are 3/8" deep (11 mm)
- Card approximately « ounce (15 grams) per batt
- Weight 13 pounds (6 kg)
- Carding teeth flexible
- No pre-teasing needed
-Table Clamps, Doffer Brush and Doffer Pin included

An instruction manual written by well known author and fiber artist Deb Menz is included with all drumcarders.
The Louet Drumcarders are made of laminated birch and have a hard white coating. In order to ensure a long life, the teeth on all Lou?t carders are made of high grade plated steel wire. All gearboxes (except on the Elite) are enclosed to prevent fibers entering the gear system.

For drumcarders it is common to mention the gear ratio that drives the licker-in when you rotate the large drum. However, what really counts for carding is the ratio of the surface speed of both drums, because the difference of surface speed does the carding. You get this surface speed ratio by multiplying the gear ratio with the ratio of the diameters of the large drum and the licker-in.

Suggested Retail is $435.00 You save $50.00. Shipping is free.

We are only authorized to sell these in the U.S. and Canada.

name: Cascade Alpaca Lana D'Oro
description:

name: Louet S10 and S10DT
description: For over a quarter century, the Louët team in Holland has been researching, designing, experimenting, and consulting with customers, to create a superior line of spinning wheels. Louët wheels treadle lightly, are low maintenance and nearly adjustment free and can be modified with accessories for the expert spinner. Louët wheels were originally geared towards spinning medium to heavy yarns. Although bobbins and flyers are available for spinning this type of yarn, the standard wheels have been redesigned to be more suitable for spinning fine to medium yarns. The orifice on the standard wheel is sufficiently large (12.5 mm or 1/2") as are the bobbins, (180-250 gr capacity), to allow you to create novelty yarns. Wheels come equipped with a two bobbin lazy kate. Technically all Louet models are the same. Each wheel has a single belt bobbin drive with an adjustable flyer brake to regulate the tension. The flexible belts are made of polyurethane and never have to be adjusted. All wheels are packed and shipped partially assembled in a flat box. The required assembly consists quite simply of tightening two nuts for which tools and instructions are provided. Wheels are made of laminated hardwood with a "birch" exterior finish. The S10 is the original Louët with minor modifications to keep it on the leading edge of spinning technology. The S10's careful design has proven to be an ideal wheel for beginners and experts alike. Sturdy construction makes it a suitable wheel for production spinners. The single hole in the wheel leads to a balanced flywheel, which ensures that the wheel always stops in the place that you stop. Constructed with solid lacquered wood. The Louet S10DT is a double treadle version. (Temporary Out-of Stock) Note: The S10 and S10DT are shipped with flyers that have sliding hooks. See image 3. Shipping is free. The regular price for the S10 is $590.00, and $699.00 for the S10DT. Note: Wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States and Canada.

name: Louet S95 and S96 Victoria
description: For over a quarter century, the Louët team in Holland has been researching, designing, experimenting, and consulting with customers, to create a superior line of spinning wheels. Louët wheels treadle lightly, are low maintenance and nearly adjustment free and can be modified with accessories for the expert spinner. Louët wheels were originally geared towards spinning medium to heavy yarns. Although bobbins and flyers are available for spinning this type of yarn, the standard wheels have been redesigned to be more suitable for spinning fine to medium yarns. The orifice on the standard wheel is sufficiently large (12.5 mm or 1/2") as are the bobbins, (180-250 gr capacity), to allow you to create novelty yarns. Wheels come equipped with a two bobbin lazy kate. Technically all Louet models are the same. Each wheel has a single belt bobbin drive with an adjustable flyer brake to regulate the tension. The flexible belts are made of polyurethane and never have to be adjusted. All wheels are packed and shipped partially assembled in a flat box. The required assembly consists quite simply of tightening two nuts for which tools and instructions are provided. Wheels are made of laminated hardwood with a "birch" exterior finish. The Victoria is not like your everyday spinning wheel. It’s light, portable and incredibly easy to use. The Victoria has been designed with precision and care, from advice received by today’s hand spinner. Available in Beech or Oak. Note: Wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States and Canada.

name: Louet Julia
description: For over a quarter century, the Louët team in Holland has been researching, designing, experimenting, and consulting with customers, to create a superior line of spinning wheels. Louët wheels treadle lightly, are low maintenance and nearly adjustment free and can be modified with accessories for the expert spinner. Louët wheels were originally geared towards spinning medium to heavy yarns. Although bobbins and flyers are available for spinning this type of yarn, the standard wheels have been redesigned to be more suitable for spinning fine to medium yarns. The orifice on the standard wheel is sufficiently large (12.5 mm or 1/2") as are the bobbins, (180-250 gr capacity), to allow you to create novelty yarns. Wheels come equipped with a two bobbin lazy kate. Technically all Louet models are the same. Each wheel has a single belt bobbin drive with an adjustable flyer brake to regulate the tension. The flexible belts are made of polyurethane and never have to be adjusted. All wheels are packed and shipped partially assembled in a flat box. The required assembly consists quite simply of tightening two nuts for which tools and instructions are provided. Wheels are made of laminated hardwood with a "birch" exterior finish. The best way to describe this wheel is a Victoria version of the S51DT. Bobbins, flyer and the Scotch tension are the same as on the Victoria. There are four ratios, which are: 1:6, 1:8.5, 1:12.5, 1:19. A removable insert provides two orifice sizes (12mm and 8mm). All rotating parts run on ball bearings for smooth operation, while the unit itself is constructed out of beech and birch plywood, smoothly lacquered. The Julia comes standard with a stand-alone 3 bobbin Lazy Kate with an adjustable brake. Wheels are made of laminated hardwood with a "birch" exterior finish. Note: Wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States and Canada.

name: Knitter's Pride Dreamz Delux Circular Set
description:
Symfonie wood Dreamz are made from densified laminated birch wood. This material is more costly and much harder than either ebony or rosewood. Unlike other wooden needles, water absorption in Symfonie wood needles is negligible and, as a result, there is no chance of warping. The same property makes these needles very strong, enables the points to be sharp and provides a lifetime of pleasurable use, if handled correctly. Please remember that all wooden needles in the lower ranges (2.0mm-3.5mm) should be treated with appropriate care. 

The delux set includes 9 pairs of needles, 4 cords (to make 24", 40" & 2 of 32"), 1 Set of size marker, 8 End caps, 4 Cord keys, 1 Cord case, packaged in a clear vinyl case (fabric cases are available).

name: Knitter's Pride Interchangeable Needle Set Cases
description:
Lovely fabric cases for your Dreamz Interchangeable Needle Set!

Please note: Needles and accessories shown in cases are for demonstration purposes only, they are not included with the case.

name: Leclerc Dorothy 15.75" 4-Shaft Table Loom
description: This 4 shaft table loom is collapsible for easy carrying and storage. It is a practical loom for schools, summer camps, occupational therapy and hobbyists.The shafts are operated by the unique side levers of graduated lengths. A 4 shaft loom comes with levers on the right. The selection of the harnesses is easy because the lever tabs are in different colors. This 4 shaft loom can be supplied with a deeper frame to which additional 4 shaft sections can be added to convert it to 8 or even 12 shafts. All you have to do is assemble the sections as you wish: they are screwed to the frame. Levers for harness frames are permanently situated. Standard Equipment: Steel Reed, 12 dents/inch 1 - Boat Shuttle 1 - Reed and Heddle Hook 2 - Metal Lease Sticks 10 - Loop cords for lashing Transfer Heddle Bars Instructions Book "Warp and Weave" Please note: We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States and Canada.

name: Maggie's Organic Cotton Short Sport Sock Tri-Pak
description:
Maggie's "Sports Socks" with moisture wicking Coolmax® are now available in a 3-Pak of colors! Designed for active cyclists and joggers with a lightweight top, cushioned bottom and extended ankle length to keep the sock put and the foot dry and cool. Our first "natural" performance sock.

Coolmax® is a registered trademark of INVISTA S.A.R.L.

Contents: 82% Certified Organic Cotton, 16% Coolmax®, 2% Spandex

Washing Instructions: Machine Wash Warm, Tumble Dry Low.

Made in USA at family owned mills in North Carolina.

Certified Organic Cotton is Fair Trade CertifiedTM and grown by a group of cooperative farmers in Nicaragua and produced according to NOP standards.
Sock size: 9-11 Woman's shoe size: 5.5-9; Men's shoe size: 4-7
Sock size: 10-13 Woman's shoe size: 10-13; Men's shoe size: 8-12.

name: Maggie's Organic Cotton Mantras Knee Hi Socks
description:
Only from Maggie's! Socks truly good for your soul as well as your sole! Knee Hi Socks made with an increased amount of Certified Organic Cotton with soothing messages written on the inner ankle. Our Mantra Socks are nearly sheer dress socks, luxuriously soft, and comfortably stretchy. Featured as one of grist.org's "15 Green Fashion Finds"! (August 2007)

Contents: 66.4% Certified Organic Cotton, 29.2% Nylon, 2.5% Spandex, 1.9% Polyester

Washing Instructions: Machine Wash Warm, Tumble Dry Low

Made in USA at family owned mills in North Carolina.

Certified Organic Cotton is Fair Trade CertifiedTM and grown by a group of cooperative farmers in Nicaragua and produced according to NOP standards.

Sock size: 9-11; Woman's shoe size: 5.5-9; Men's shoe size: 4-7

name: Maggie's Organic Cotton Knee Hi Socks Tri-Pak
description:
These tri-paks offer Maggie's patterned knee hi socks at a great value. Get 3 pairs of knee his – all stars, all stripes, or a mix. All Made in the USA and still featuring Maggie's soft, comfy “stay-up” style.

Contents: 68.3% Certified Organic Cotton, 29.6% Nylon, 2.1% Spandex

Washing Instructions: Machine Wash Warm, Tumble Dry Low

Fiber and Yarn from Turkey or Pakistan, produced according to NOP standards, spun at a GOTS and FLO certified facility.

Made by family owned mills in North Carolina, USA

Size: 9-11; Woman's shoe size: 5.5-9; Men's shoe size: 4-7.

Maggie's classic knee hi is available in this fun patterned style (We call these "Cat In The Hat" socks! So much fun!). Made in the USA, they are still the softest, most comfy “stay-up” knee hi sock around!

description:
Using the best quality Argentinian Wool, Maggie's introduces the ultimate Wool Knee Sock. Your feet will feel luxurious in the warm wool combined with the perfect length and a super-soft cushion in the foot. These socks are great for hiking, motorcycle rides, or everyday as a boot sock and are sized to fit feet large and small. Not only is this a fantastic sock, the wool is completely processed in the USA from raw fiber to finished sock.

Contents: 75% Organic Wool, 24% Nylon, 1% Spandex

Fiber Grown in Argentina (according to NOP standards) Yarn spun in US or Peru (according to GOTS standards).

Made by a family-owned mill in North Carolina, USA.

Sock size: 10-13; Woman's shoe size: 10-13; Men's shoe size: 8-12

name: Kromski Minstrel
description:
From the Kromskis of Poland, the Minstrel is setting a new standard for castle style wheels. It features a wide, steady base for the double treadle operation and the wheel, which is larger than many upright wheels at 18". The wheel is easy to mount on the two support posts. The third post will mount an optional distaff.

The Minstrel has stronger, bolder lines and a larger base to accommodate the larger wheel diameter and the double treadles. It is a double drive wheel but comes standard with Scotch tension set-up if you prefer the single drive feel. A threading hook and extra whorl are conveniently stored up front for easy access.

The Minstrel is made of European alder and birch. The design is perfect for reenactors. Very easy to assemble.

Details
  • Wheel diameter: 18"
  • Orifice height: 33"; size: 3/8"
  • Bobbins: 3 included
  • Included: treading hook, attached Lazy Kate, and bottle of spinning wheel oil
  • Ratios: 6.5, 8.5, 12 and 16 to 1; 2 whorls included
  • Bearings on wheel crank; leather bearings on flyer
  • Weight: 13 lbs.

    • The Minstrel is available unfinished or with a factory clear, walnut or mahogany finish.

    Bonus! Receive 3 free bobbins when you order a Minstrel...a $51.00 to $54.75 value!

    All wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We place your order with the distributor as soon as we get it. Orders are usually shipped the next business day by the distributor.

    Please note: We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States.

name: Kromski Polonaise
description:
The Polonaise has the look of wheels from the Baltic area of Poland and Scandinavia. In fact, a well known spinning wheel historian has said that the manner in which this wheel is built is as close to being historically correct as he has seen. This will be a plus for spinners wanting the "real thing" and for the growing community of reenactors. The amount of decorative turning on this wheel is substantial, making it a sight to behold. The level of detail and turning is breathtaking. No other wheel being made today comes close to this level of detail. A spinner could pay substantially more for other wheels and still not have the beauty of a Kromski. This wheel is a great value and it spins as well as it looks.

The Polonaise is made with European alder and birch and comes standard with double drive and Scotch tension.

Details
  • Wheel diameter: 24"
  • Orifice height: 25"; size: 3/8"
  • Bobbins: 3 included
  • Included: threading hook, vertical style tensioned Lazy Kate, and a bottle of spinning oil
  • Ratios: 8, 12, 16, and 20 to 1; 2 whorls included
  • Leather bearings on flyer
  • Weight: 16 lbs.

    • It is available unfinished (not shown) or in a clear, walnut or mahogany finish.

    Bonus! Receive 3 free bobbins when you order a Polonaise...a $51.00 to $54.75 value!

    All wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We place your order with the distributor as soon as we get it. Orders are usually shipped the next business day by the distributor.

    Please note: We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States.

name: Kromski Prelude
description:
Just the wheel for beginners (though you may never outgrow it) or perhaps a second Kromski wheel for others. It has the look of an antique wheel and the high degree of wood turning that the Kromskis are famous for, but it also has all the touches modern spinners expect.

The Prelude in a single drive wheel (Scotch tension). The Prelude is easy to treadle, very easy to transport, and has an 18" diameter wheel (same as the Kromski Minstrel) for excellent ratios. If you like you can swivel the mother-of-all in line with the bench for a more compact "package" when moving the wheel or for storage. The Prelude is made of European alder and birch. This is the perfect wheel for reenactors.

Details
  • Wheel diameter: 18"
  • Orifice height: 26"; size: 3/8"
  • Bobbins: 3 included
  • Included: threading hook, attached Lazy Kate, bottle of spinning wheel oil
  • Ratios: 6, 10.5, and 13 to 1
  • Bearings on wheel shaft; leather bearings on flyer
  • Elastic drive band
  • Weight: 9 lbs.

    • This wheel comes boxed as a kit, but goes together quickly. It is available unfinished or with a factory clear, walnut, or mahogany finish.

    The Prelude is comparable to the Ashford Traveller, yet weights less and costs less. See the comparison chart in the images.

    Bonus! Receive 3 free bobbins when you order a Prelude...a $51.00 to $54.75 value!

    All wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We place your order with the distributor as soon as we get it. Orders are usually shipped the next business day by the distributor.

    Please note: We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States.

name: Kromski Sonata
description:
From the Kromskis of Poland, the Sonata is a marriage between the classic architecture and design concepts shared with all other Kromski wheels and the functional needs of a wheel that folds. You get both.

The Sonata is a full-size spinning wheel that folds and packs away as a small package, making it perfect for traveling, guild and festival gatherings or simply storage when not in use. The Kromskis have put a lot of thought into the Sonata. Full size yet small dimensions when folded, easy to set-up and take down, solid feel, solid footprint, plenty of foot room, easy treadling on double treadles, orifice at a comfortable height and classic looks. Spokes that draw your attention, every piece of wood cuts, curves and character; this is an appealing spinning wheel that is a pleasure to use.

A custom-made, heavily padded bag offering you a convenient way to pack-up your Sonata for travel and storage is included with your purchase of a Kromski Sonata.

Details
  • Wheel diameter: 19"
  • Folded dimensions: 22" by 19"
  • Orifice height: 30", but can be raised as much as 2"; size: 3/8"
  • Bobbins: 3 included
  • Single drive with Scotch tension
  • Included: threading hook, attached Lazy Kate, and bottle of spinning oil.
  • Ratios: 6.7, 12.5, 14 to 1
  • Ball bearings on wheel crank; flyer bearings are custom designed injection molded parts engineered by the Kromskis for excellend performance.
  • Weight: 11.5 lbs.

    • Available with a clear, mahogany or walnut finish.

    Compare with the Ashford Joy and Schacht Matchless and save! See the comparison chart in the images.

    All wheels are drop shipped from the distributor. We place your order with the distributor as soon as we get it. Orders are usually shipped the next business day by the distributor.

    Please note: We are only authorized to sell to individuals in the Continental United States.

name: Kromski Symphony
description:
Just the image you would expect a spinning wheel to take. You can picture the "ladies in waiting" gathered together in the castle spinning as a group, all on the Symphony.

This wheel has the details spinners have come to expect with Kromski products - lots of finely turned wood, attention to detail, and all the features spinners ask for. Start with a good size wheel diameter - 24" - that rotates on bearing sleeves that contribute to effortless treadling. The double treadles are well engineered to be comfortable through long spinning sessions. The flyer is double drive but also has Scotch tensioning for single drive use.

The Symphony is made of European alder and birch. This is a perfect wheel for reenactors.

Details
  • Wheel diameter: 24"
  • Orifice height: 27"; size: 3/8"
  • Bobbins: 3 included
  • Included: threading hook, arch style tensioned Kate, and bottle of spinning oil
  • Ratios: 7.5, 10, 16, and 20 to 1; 2 whorls included
  • Bearings on wheel shaft and treadle; leather bearings on flyer
  • Weight: 15 lbs.

    • The Symphony is available unfinished, or with a factory clear, walnut or mahogany finish.

    Compare the Symphony to the Ashford Traditional and the Ashford Elizabeth2. It out performs them, weights less, and it is a much better price than either of them! See the comparison chart in the images.
